text:
I use a variation of this example to post bets: <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/blob/master/examples/exampletwo.py>

Each posted bet takes like 2 seconds to complete. What am I missing?

text: <https://www.google.com/search?q=betfair+delay+in+placing+a+bet>
<https://support.developer.betfair.com/hc/en-us/articles/360002825652-Why-do-you-have-a-delay-on-placing-bets-on-a-market-that-is-in-play->

attachments.title: Why do you have a delay on placing bets on a market that is ‘in-play’
attachments.text: In-play markets usually carry a time delay varying from 1-12 seconds. This delay is in place to allow customers to cancel unmatched orders on the system when there is a change in market conditions....
attachments.fallback: Betfair Developer Program: Why do you have a delay on placing bets on a market that is ‘in-play’

text: think of the websocket as a one-way input stream *from* BetFair, to your system

elements.text: think of the websocket as a one-way input stream
from
BetFair, to your system

text: you connect to them, and they send things to you, one-way, from them, to you

elements.text: you connect to them, and they send things to you, one-way, from them, to you

text: (technically you do send them some data, but it's irrelevant for this)

elements.text: (technically you do send them some data, but it's irrelevant for this)

text: for placing bets, you're doing fairly simple HTTP POST calls with JSON data, which has nothing to do with the websocket

elements.text: for placing bets, you're doing fairly simple HTTP POST calls with JSON data, which has nothing to do with the websocket

text: you'd be able to place bets via CURL, on the command line, if you knew all the parameters

text: every "passive" request to BetFair, placing a bet, getting account funds, etc. is done via their standard POST API
